image.altText: Penny Wong shakes hands with Premier Li Qiang in front of a panda enclosure at Adelaide Zoo

props.synopsis: Pandas Yi Lan and Xing Qiu will touch down in Adelaide this weekend, but experts say China uses the animals as a "soft power" move politically.

title.children: South Australia's two new pandas are almost here. What are the politics behind them?

image.altText: alleged false cancer victim

props.synopsis: An Adelaide couple remain in custody over allegations they falsely claimed their six-year-old son was undergoing cancer treatment and received $60,000 in donations. Here's what we know.

title.children: Police allege a couple faked son's cancer to claim donations. Here's what we know

image.altText: Toronto NSW

props.synopsis: An oppressive heatwave stretching from Darwin to Victoria will send temperatures soaring up to 15 degrees Celsius above average during the coming days.

title.children: Hottest summer weather in five years predicted for coming days

image.altText: Teenager with racing car.

props.synopsis: At least 600 kilometres from his nearest racing track, country teen Jett Zerk will train each day on his Xbox in his bedroom before heading to Bathurst.

title.children: Teen set to be one of the youngest drivers ever to hit Bathurst track

image.altText: liberal leader john gardner speaks while wearing a hat

props.synopsis: The member for Morialta has cited the "toll" public life has had on his family as well as a recent melanoma removal as reasons for his looming departure. The announcement of John Gardner's retirement has capped off a tumultuous year for the Liberal Party.

title.children: Deputy leader of SA Liberal Party John Gardner to leave politics citing 'toll' on family

image.altText: Open fields with some brown and green patches expanding to the horizon.

props.synopsis: The Electoral Districts Boundaries Commission found it was unsuitable for the seat to continue to be named after Edward Frome, due to his involvement in the aftermath of the hanging of two Aboriginal people.

title.children: SA's seat of Frome renamed 'Ngadjuri' after concerns over namesake

image.altText: A grey-haired, bearded man in a dark blazer sits on the steps of a government building.

props.synopsis: A crowd of people, including past and present political adversaries, have joined a live audience for David Bevan's final broadcast as Mornings presenter ahead of his retirement.

title.children: Veteran ABC presenter David Bevan signs off after more than 30 years in media

image.altText: A pregnant woman holds her stomach

props.synopsis: The South Australian Government's response to a bungle that resulted in the potential miscalculation of 1,700 pregnant women's due dates was "sub-optimal" and "inappropriately prolonged", but there was no harm caused to patients, an independent review has found.

title.children: Due date bungle was 'inappropriately prolonged' by 'sub-optimal' response, report finds

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt with a Santa hat on hangs a red bauble on a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Converts say there's nothing like the smell of a real Christmas tree, and sustainability and cost concerns are prompting more people to choose them over plastic ones.

title.children: Real Christmas trees a more sustainable, affordable option for some families

image.altText: An Asian elephant in a crate before moving from Perth to Adelaide.

props.synopsis: One of Perth Zoo's beloved elephants will depart for a new home in South Australia much sooner than originally planned, with keepers now convinced the female should be moved next month.

title.children: Elephant 'in desperate need of company' set for early safari park move

image.altText: Two men and a woman leave a court building down a ramp

props.synopsis: James Bryson has been given jail time for causing the deaths of Deborah Thomson and Dennis Frazer just over a year after the fatal crash at Willalooka. Judge Barrett said Bryson had filmed himself driving at 150kph on the morning of the crash while holding a can of beer.

title.children: James Bryson to spend at least six years in jail over double-fatal crash

image.altText: Two women and a man sitting at a long table in a function room.

props.synopsis: Wine grape growers have spoken at a senate inquiry to plead for a mandatory code of conduct to ensure they get fair prices for their produce.

title.children: Grape growers at breaking point plead for mandatory code of conduct

image.altText: Steven Hainsworth is dressed in a green tracksuit and sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Steven Hainsworth is standing trial accused of murdering three people in a "violent and deliberate" manner over the span of more than a decade. His defence lawyer tells the court a pet dog could have transferred his DNA onto one of his alleged victims.

title.children: Steven Hainsworth's lawyer says dog could have transferred DNA onto victim's body

image.altText: Three brown rabbits in a green field.

props.synopsis: Scientists are asking people to collect dead rabbits to help research whether biological tools are still effective in controlling surging wild rabbit populations across Australia.

title.children: Rabbit numbers explode posing questions about control methods

image.altText: A family of five Syrian refugees sitting on a brown couch.

props.synopsis: The Alrahmo family has spent eight years making a life in Australia since fleeing war-torn Syria with their six children. Now the Bashar al-Assad regime has fallen, they finally feel safe enough to consider returning home to see loved ones.

title.children: Syrian refugee family hopeful of seeing loved ones after fall of Assad

image.altText: A close-up photo of Pembroke College librarian Kate Sylvia.

props.synopsis: Three years after Kate Sylvia's death from blood clots, a doctor tells an inquest he "didn't take in" notes from paramedics that she was taking the contraceptive pill.

title.children: Doctor unaware of contraceptive pill before wrongly diagnosing migraine

image.altText: Blurred shot of people walking through a neon-lit street at night

props.synopsis: Thai media reports say the boy was found at the steps of a shop in Pattaya where he had collapsed with a knife blade in his back.

title.children: 14yo Australian boy stabbed to death in Thailand, police say

image.altText: Proxy woman out front of house

props.synopsis: Imagine a situation of domestic violence, where the primary aggressor — the person perpetrating the violence — is identified as the victim. And with the tables turned, that victim is wrongly identified as the perpetrator.

title.children: The 'mad or bad woman trope' devastating victims of domestic violence

image.altText: The Gabba is flooded by rain during the third Test between India and Australia.

props.synopsis: Overcast skies welcome Australia and India to Brisbane for the third Border-Gavaskar Test at the Gabba, with play halted in the opening session as heavy rain settles in. Follow live.

title.children: Torrential downpour turns Gabba into swimming pool, threatening to wipe out day one of third Test

image.altText: Split cherries amongst leaves.

props.synopsis: The country's two largest cherry producing states lose a third of their fruit due to heavy rain, which could see prices rise.

title.children: Rain-hit cherries 'explode' in several states, slashing Christmas supply

image.altText: Australian and Papua New Guinea Prime Ministers hold up each countries respective signed  jerseys at the PM XIII 2022 Lang Park

props.synopsis: The federal government has closed out the year with a flurry of Pacific announcements designed to shore up Australia's strategic position and push back on China's ambitions in the region.

title.children: Australia's bid to reinvigorate Pacific diplomacy has risks as well as rewards

image.altText: Merav Solomon wears a blue shirt and is pictured in a park.

props.synopsis: After a suspected terror attack on a Melbourne synagogue, Jewish Australians reflect on their hopes and fears.

title.children: A week on, Australia’s Jewish community feeling unsettled, but supported

image.altText: A man and a woman in formal wear walk through soldiers in gold hats featuring plumes

props.synopsis: The Syrian regime was also one of the world's biggest drug syndicates. What happens to the multi-billion-dollar drug trade now that the "narco-state" has fallen?

title.children: Uncertainty swirls around tiny pill that reanimated Syria's zombie economy

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: An investigation by a Queensland police organised crime squad has led to the arrests of three Australian soldiers, all aged 23 and living in Townsville.

title.children: Three ADF soldiers arrested on drug trafficking charges

image.altText: Three men in suits stand in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Energy analysts say the Coalition's nuclear plan will be more expensive, burn more carbon, result in a smaller economy, and be more disruptive than Peter Dutton claims.

title.children: Top energy experts criticise Dutton's $331 billion nuclear gamble

image.altText: A middle-aged Indian man waves as he is carried through a crowd of people, many of whom are filming him with phones.

props.synopsis: Film star Allu Arjun, 42, was arrested on Friday a week and a half after his appearance at the screening in early December allegedly prompted a stampede by fans that crushed a woman to death.

title.children: Indian star arrested after stampede at public appearance

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: A list of seven requests has been issued to the Commonwealth by NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro to tackle recent violent crime in Alice Springs. It includes a call for Centrelink payments to be distributed on days when takeaway alcohol sales are banned in the outback town.

title.children: NT chief minister calls for welfare payment changes in Alice Springs

image.altText: Britain's Prince Andrew leaves Westminster Abbey following the coronation ceremony.

props.synopsis: The 50-year-old man was banned in March 2023 but his relationship to the prince has only come to light in a written ruling released on Thursday.

title.children: Suspected Chinese spy forged close links with Prince Andrew before UK ban

image.altText: A tight shot of Emmanuel Macron and Francois Bayrou hugging

props.synopsis: It follows a historic no-confidence vote against former prime minister Michel Barnier in the National Assembly.

title.children: Emmanuel Macron announces François Bayrou as new French prime minister

image.altText: A group of Japanese people hold rainbow flags and signs in support of marriage equality.

props.synopsis: It is the eighth of nine recent high court decisions that have ruled against Japan's ban on same-sex marriage.

title.children: Japanese high court rules same-sex marriage ban unconstitutional

image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: The worker was paid $11,212 for roughly three years of work as a domestic worker at the Sri Lankan High Commissioner's residence in Canberra.

title.children: Diplomat's employee paid 90c hourly wins $117,000 in court

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat holding a petridish

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed a cost-effective wound treatment, which uses the Indigenous bush remedy lemon myrtle oil as a key ingredient.

title.children: Researchers turn bush remedy into 'life changing' wound treatment

image.altText: Gregory Geason wearing a blue suit with bus in background

props.synopsis: Former Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason pleaded guilty in a NSW court to one count of contravening a restriction specified in an AVO.

title.children: Former Supreme Court judge sentenced after breaching domestic violence order

image.altText: Children and women gather around the remnants of a burnt out truck.

props.synopsis: Pakistan's government denies the shooting deaths reported by ousted leader Imran Khan's party, while journalists on the ground reveal the roadblocks they've faced trying to uncover the true death toll.

title.children: As Imran Khan mourns, Pakistan government denies protest deaths

image.altText: A still from an animated film showing armed figures on horseback silhouetted by a large glowing full moon

props.synopsis: The new film tells the story of an attack on the people of Rohan, pulled from Tolkien's writing. But they've added a brand-new character.

title.children: Lord of the Rings, but make it anime: The War of the Rohirrim is here
